instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: liquid spill, both usb-c ports were stained with cranberry juice, and replacing both revived the MacBook. Works 100% other than these key problems. I haven't dived into the caps lock led yet. Just the three keys that don't work. I'm focusing right now on <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> for these three. There's 3.3v coming in on pin 10. Pins 1-3 <SIGNAL>KBD_RIGHT_SHIFT_KEY</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>KBD_LEFT_OPTION_KEY</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>KBD_CONTROL_KEY</SIGNAL> all have zero volts. Pins 7-9 each has 1.8v. Pin 4 has 1.8, and pin 6 has zero volts. On a whim I replaced <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> and same results. What's the distinction between   <SIGNAL>KBD_RIGHT_SHIFT_KEY</SIGNAL>    and     <SIGNAL>KBD_RIGHT_SHIFT_L</SIGNAL>  ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> inputs, w/ and w/o keyboard connected.

To properly check amy key:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.google.com/search?q=keyboard+tester&client=firefox-b-d&bih=615&biw=1408&hl=es&ei=3vfeYdiSCcCNjLsP8t29IA&ved=0ahUKEwjY-aXNx6z1AhXABmMBHfJuDwQQ4dUDCA0&uact=5&oq=keyboard+tester&gs_&sclient=gws-wiz[/URL]
I prefer to use
[URL unfurl="true"]https://en.key-test.ru/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
thanks for that
in diode mode, input pins 1-3 all register ~1.83v with and without keyboard connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Please, read how to properly check diode mode:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
ok, thank you,  
input pins 1-3 all register ~.485v with and without keyboard connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Try another keyboard.
Do you get 1.8V at pin 1 of J6701?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
different keyboard, same result. diode check is done without power connected, right?
and yes I get 1.8v pin 1 of J6701

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: All the other keys tested in browser, as above mentioned?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: yes, done, all other keys work

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Remove DZ6701 and test again.
Be sure to have good solders and traces at <CHIP>U6703</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: all three are ~.472v  after DZ6701 removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Change <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> again.
Be sure to get good solders and check its traces to KB connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
[ATTACH type="full" width="287px"]60371[/ATTACH]
the kb connector is just reverse of this, that area is in perfect condition. I found another <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> and re-soldered it. The input pin diode measurements are all .482-.485v. However, I do not get any voltage on the corresponding pins of the keyboard connector. DZ6701 is still removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: by the way, those two bare areas bottom left of the pads are copper trace, I scraped them just enough to see a little shine-- **and there is continuity between pin 4 and the resistor it leads to**

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: so I re-soldered DZ6701, and checked the kb connector pins and still 0. I found another DZ6701 and soldered it and still 0v for the three inputs on the kb connector. I get 1.8v still on <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> pins 7-9, and basically still 0 on pins 1-3.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Possibly bad contacts at J6701; maybe crap underneath.

Check voltage on similar pins of keyboard connector from another board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
contacts look clean
I compared <CHIP>U6703</CHIP> voltages on a board from a working system and found that pin 6 should have 3.3v but our board in question is almost zero. this must be significant, yes?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
Yes, reset output should be high.
That's the reason I suspected <CHIP>U6703</CHIP>.
Just in case, check <RESISTOR>R6752</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R8014</RESISTOR>.

On the other board, all 3 inputs have 0V?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: yes all three inputs on the board from the working system are also 0V. after my last message I checked out <RESISTOR>R6752</RESISTOR> and it was low and it basically broke off while I was testing, so I replaced it and now 3.3V on pin 6 reset output of <CHIP>U6703</CHIP>. Also <RESISTOR>R8014</RESISTOR> now has 3.3V on both pins. but still no voltage on the kb connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message: I was going to test <RESISTOR>R6703</RESISTOR> and it's missing. let me replace that and post back here

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 2019 <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>, right shift key, left option, control, and caps lock led not working
threads.message:
I replaced <RESISTOR>R6703</RESISTOR>. And then discovered pins 28-30 on the keyboard connector don't get voltage. So I decided to connect the board to a keyboard and test it and all three keys plus the caps lock LED now work
thank you for your help!!
